title: Examples markdown
Examples markdown
text: extreme evidence support species.
code: all_data = iris[iris$Species=='setosa',] questioned_data = all_data[1:(nrow(all_data)/2),] known_data = all_data[(nrow(all_data)/2+1):nrow(all_data),] background_data = iris[iris$Species!='setosa',] background_data_id = 'Species' y = names(questioned_data)[1:4] BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y, x=NA, questioned_data, known_data, background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" ## [1] 20.11275

title: Examples markdown
text: extreme evidence support different species.
code: set.seed(10)  ## create questioned data questioned_data = iris[iris$Species=='versicolor',] split_ind <- sample(seq_len(nrow(questioned_data)), size = floor(0.5 * nrow(questioned_data))) background_data1 = questioned_data[-split_ind,] questioned_data = questioned_data[split_ind,]  ## create known data known_data = iris[iris$Species=='virginica',] split_ind <- sample(seq_len(nrow(known_data)), size = floor(0.5 * nrow(known_data))) background_data2 = known_data[-split_ind,] known_data = known_data[split_ind,]  ## create background data background_data = rbind(iris[iris$Species=='setosa',],                         background_data1,                         background_data2) ## Test background_data_id = 'Species' y = names(questioned_data)[1:4] BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y,x=NA,questioned_data,known_data,                               background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" ## [1] -30.08559

title: Examples markdown
text: Bare mention supporting different sources.
code: library(LaplacesDemon) #for sampling for multivariate normal  ## create questioned data questioned_data = as.data.frame(rmvn(10,rep(0,2),array(c(2,0.5,0.5,2),dim = c(2,2))))  ## create known data known_data = as.data.frame(rmvn(8,rep(2,2),array(c(2,0.5,0.5,2),dim = c(2,2))))  ## create background data background_data = as.data.frame(rbind(rmvn(10,rep(0.5,2),array(c(1,0.2,0.2,2),dim = c(2,2))),                        rmvn(10,rep(1.5,2),array(c(6,0.3,0.3,4),dim = c(2,2))),                        rmvn(10,rep(3,2),array(c(3,0.8,0.8,3),dim = c(2,2))))) background_data['id'] = rep(1:3,each=10)  ## Test background_data_id = 'id' y = names(questioned_data)[1:2] logBF = BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y,x=NA,questioned_data,known_data,background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" exp(logBF) ## [1] 0.4737203

what: Kaggle dataset Students Performance in Exams
title: Examples markdown
code: students_df = read.csv('StudentsPerformance.csv') head(students_df) ##   gender race.ethnicity parental.level.of.education        lunch ## 1 female        group B           bachelor's degree     standard ## 2 female        group C                some college     standard ## 3 female        group B             master's degree     standard ## 4   male        group A          associate's degree free/reduced ## 5   male        group C                some college     standard ## 6 female        group B          associate's degree     standard ##   test.preparation.course math.score reading.score writing.score ## 1                    none         72            72            74 ## 2               completed         69            90            88 ## 3                    none         90            95            93 ## 4                    none         47            57            44 ## 5                    none         76            78            75 ## 6                    none         71            83            78

previous_headings: Kaggle dataset Students Performance in Exams
title: Examples markdown
text: extreme evidence support parental education level.
code: all_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education=="master's degree",]  questioned_data = all_data[1:(nrow(all_data)/2),]  known_data = all_data[(nrow(all_data)/2+1):nrow(all_data),]  background_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education!="master's degree",]  background_data_id = 'parental.level.of.education' y = names(students_df)[6:8] BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y, x=NA, questioned_data, known_data, background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" ## [1] 9.477495

previous_headings: Kaggle dataset Students Performance in Exams
title: Examples markdown
text: extreme evidence support different parental education level.
code: questioned_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education=="master's degree",]  known_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education=="high school",]  background_data = students_df[!students_df$parental.level.of.education %in% c("master's degree","high school"),]  background_data_id = 'parental.level.of.education' y = names(students_df)[6:8] BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y, x=NA, questioned_data, known_data, background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" ## [1] -7.052084

what: Different parental education level test with predictors
title: Examples markdown
text: strong evidence support different parental education level.
code: #install.packages("fastDummies") library(fastDummies)   # Create dummy variable students_df <- dummy_cols(students_df,                    select_columns = c("race.ethnicity"))  students_df['race.ethnicity_group A'] = 1  questioned_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education=="master's degree",]  known_data = students_df[students_df$parental.level.of.education=="high school",]  background_data = students_df[!students_df$parental.level.of.education %in% c("master's degree","high school"),]  background_data_id = 'parental.level.of.education' y = names(students_df)[6:8] x = names(students_df)[9:13] BayesMuCoSoT_fit(y, x, questioned_data, known_data, background_data,background_data_id) ## [1] "Prior elicitation finished" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering common modeling per source" ## [1] "Sampling from posterior considering different modeling per source" ## [1] "Calculating Bayes factor" ## [1] -4.884342

what: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling for Common Source Testing — BayesMuCoSoT_fit
title: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling for Common Source Testing — BayesMuCoSoT_fit
text: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling Common Source Testing

title: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling for Common Source Testing — BayesMuCoSoT_fit
code: BayesMuCoSoT_fit(   y,   x = NA,   questioned_data,   known_data,   background_data = NA,   background_data_id = NA,   approach = "independent prior",   BayesFactor_Approximation = "Bridge Sampling",   prior_elicitation = "Maximum Likelihood",   DoF = "min",   verbose = TRUE,   ... )

title: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling for Common Source Testing — BayesMuCoSoT_fit
text: y Vector response columns names (p=variables). x Predictors columns names (d=predictors). . questioned_data Data frame unknown data. known_data Data frame known data. background_data Background data frame estimate prior parameters. Background data recommended. background_data_id Column name background data frame discriminate data per id. approach "conjugate" "independent prior" approach. Default "independent prior" BayesFactor_Approximation "Laplace-Metropolis" "Generalized Harmonic Mean" "Bridge Sampling". Default "Bridge Sampling".  conjugate approach Bayes factor comes close form. prior_elicitation "Non-Informative" "Maximum Likelihood" list type list(U= inverse Wishart's scale matrix p p, beta_mu= matrix mean matrix Normal d p, beta_cov= d covariances matrix (3D matrix p p d). Default "Maximum Likelihood" estimations Background data. DoF Degrees freedom prior inverse Wishart distribution. Default "min": p+2. Otherwise, integer bigger p+2. verbose messages running. Default TRUE. ... arguments jags R2jags function.

title: Bayesian Multivariate Normal Modelling for Common Source Testing — BayesMuCoSoT_fit
text: logarithmic Bayes factor.
